name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Madrid Prado

reviews.text: We ended our family trip to Spain in Madrid and used the Radisson Blu as our base because of its proximity to the Prado and triangle of museums along the Paseo del Prado. The Radisson was quiet, clean and would be excellent for business travelers that want to stay in a more touristy part of town. Staff speak English and do so well...better than at other hotels we stayed at during our trip. Rooms are not particularly large, but they are comfortable - and space comes at a premium in Europe. In a nutshell, the hotel is not particularly romantic, but the location is hard to beat for art lovers...or tourists who want a quick shot to Atocha station to catch the AVE to Toledo, Sevilla and other spots for the day.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel Across from Classic Art

reviews.text: The hotel is at a great location in center of Madrid. The public transport is easily accessible and some of the most famous museums are at walking distance from the hotel. The rooms are a little small but comfortable. The staff is courteous. The morning (american) breakfast is standard as in all European business hotels. The hotel has nice fitness center with a heated swimming pool. Try to get a room with balcony. There are few cafeterias and restaurant near the hotel to enjoy a nice meal.
reviews.title: Radisson Blu, Madrid Prado

reviews.text: This is different from other Radisson hotels. Very simple and old looking hotel near the Centre but not lavish which you expect from this brand. Due to being in Madrid it is expensive as compared to other hotels. Rooms are also small as compared to other hotels of this brand. I would not rate this hotel too high because I have lived in some great Radisson hotels which are much bigger, lavish with great lobby. I stayed there for 4 nights with family on holiday may be because of that I found it very quite & calm. For business travel this should be good.
reviews.title: Nice & Quite Hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed twice on business at this hotel and can recommend it.

reviews.text: Discovering how to turn all the lights off in the room is a bit of a challenge, there's a plethora of light switches. Top tip, look for the round switch near the air con unit. It looks like it should control the air con but it is the master light switch.
